Package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.cielab

package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.cielab
CIELAB, the 1976 CIE L*A*B* color space. This color space has L (lightness), A (one of the chromatic channels; something like cyan-to-red), and B (the other chromatic channel; somewhere between blue-to-yellow) channels. It is an older, widely-used color space that is mostly very good at perceptual uniformity (except between bluish colors). Like IPT_HQ, this compresses a -1 to 1 range for its chromatic channels down to the 0 to 1 range by shrinking them and re-centering on 0.5 instead of 0.0. This is different from Oklab, which just offsets its -0.5 to 0.5 range.
This package offers a SimplePalette class like the one in the ipt_hq and oklab package, and compatible with the same descriptions (though the resulting colors will be a little different). IPT_HQ, Oklab, and CIELAB are all very good at mixing colors evenly, with CIELAB or Oklab probably best.

  • Palette by hue

  • Class Summary
    Class
    Description
    ColorTools
    Contains code for manipulating colors as int and packed float values in the CIE L*A*B* color space.
    GradientTools
    Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of FloatLists.
    Palette
    A palette of predefined colors as packed IPT floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
    SimplePalette
    A palette of predefined colors as packed CIELAB floats, the kind ColorTools works with, plus a way to describe colors by combinations and adjustments.
